subject: Investing
title: Keeping Up with the Neighbors
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Keeping Up with the Neighbors.

hook.text: A man tripled his risk exposure because a coworker bragged about doubling his money on a hot stock.

buildup.text: Comparing your returns to others triggers envy and pushes you toward riskier bets.

discovery.text: People share wins loudly and losses quietly. You're comparing your full record to their highlight reel.

twist.text: The neighbor bragging about gains today rarely mentions the 50% loss they took last year.

climax.text: Your benchmark should be your own financial plan, not someone else's cherry-picked success story.

punchline.text: Run your own race. Someone else's portfolio isn't your finish line.

quiz.question: Why is comparing returns to others dangerous?
options: People share wins but hide losses
